title: Fix to unexpected behavior when passing null to $location.search
fix(ngRepeat): parsing of repeat_expression
body:
Tweaked the regex used for tokenizing the repeat_expression.  Subsequently tweaked the assignment to rhs as a result of the new regex.

Closes #3018

title: Small enhancement in "Hello, World!" tutorial from the AngularJS cookbook
fix(docs): set ng-app for editing with plunker
body: Closes #3011

title: fix($location): search should expand array values properly
body:
Calling kind of $location.search('foo', [1,2]) results in a query like "/path/d/#/?foo=1,2"
which is undesirable. This commit enhance $location to build url like "/path/d/#/?foo=1&foo=2".
At the same time calling $location.search() will give {foo: [1,2]}.

title: docs(ngRepeat): Fix typo
Saucelabs tunnel setup demo
body: this PR demonstrates how we can establish a tunnel to saucelabs.

title: docs(tutorial): fix formatting and typo
body:
The index page of tutorial is having problems with markup. I believe
this is because the entire page is wrapped in a div? To fix, for now,
just switched markup to HTML for lists and heading.
Also fixed a typo sentence in step_00 to read cleaner.

title: Allow promise returned by $http to be decorated
body:
Exposes a `promiseDecorators` array on `$httpProvider` that can have functions pushed onto it. When `$http` is invoked, each decorator function will be called with the promise object that will be returned to the caller as an argument, allowing the decorator to add "flavor" methods, similar to `success()` and `error()`.

This is an implementation for the issue I created earlier this week, #2982. It's such a small change I figured I'd just throw it out there and see if there's any interest.

If you don't feel like clicking to the issue, here's the rationale: formerly you could decorate the promise object returned by `$http` using a response interceptor, but since the request interceptor refactoring that's no longer possible. This change allows users to add their own application domain–specific handler methods that can integrate with such non-standard cross-cutting concerns as validation and security handling. At present, the only ways to accomplish this are wrapping `$http`, putting it behind a proxy service, or replacing it completely.

body: Here's a first pass at the error stripper. It strips and collects errors just fine. I'm have jasmine-node tests for this, but I'm not sure how to tie them in with the rest of Angular. I would appreciate any feedback.

Pick the right attribute value for form.$name if ng-form directive is used as an attribute
body:
Pick the right attribute value for form.$name if ng-form directive is used as an attribute. This is especially important when you want your inner form to be published as a control of its parent form. Currently, if you have this code snippet: ```html
...
``` -> mainForm.subForm will not be available ----------------- ```html
...
``` -> while it will work in this case.

title: Support extracting resources from wrapped responses and storing metadata.
Update directive.ngdoc
body: typo "normalized accessed" => "normalized access"

title: prevents unwanted opening of the soft keyboard
body: Ghost clicks are busted but the corresponding form elements are still focused. This means that for example on smartphones the soft keyboard will be opened. This pull request prevents the unwanted opening of the soft keyboard.

title: feat(ngName): allow interpolated name for form controls
body:
ngName allows forms' fields to set their name dynamically, especially useful with ngRepeat.
Right now is not possible to validate form controls like this: ```<input type="text" name="{{field.name}}" ng-model="field.data">```
The current work-around is to use one nested form for each field but indeed it's an hack rather than a solution.

This implementation could be moved inside the directive ```ngModel``` or within its own directive ```ngName```, I left intentionally it in the NgModelController because it's slightly faster, however I can refactor it as you prefer.

this fixes also the issues #1404 and #2426

title: feat(MockHttpExpectation): matchData supports function as data
body:
Add support for passing function as validating data:
 - To avoid hacking test method of RegExp
 - Optionally overwrite toString method of fn to show validation tips

title: Added Event Directives
body: I've added ```ng-focus``` and ```ng-blur``` as two further default *event directives* which should be available for users inside AngularJS.

title: Docs/tutorial: add missing 'node' command, wrap directory text in <code>
Add some commas make tutorial read more clearly
body: This read a little funny when I was looking over the tutorial. I think this clears it up.

title: update $httpBackend.flush() example in docs
body:
update to reflect separation of scopes and controllers

adjust ordering of .expect() .flush() calls to reflect the fact that
.flush() calls .verifyNoOutstandingExpectations()

add spec for the inverted case, when initial asynchronous request does
not complete, better illustrating the use of flush() to control
the response from asynchronous requests.

title: chore(minErr): replace ngError with minErr
body: We removed ngError and replaced all calls to ngError with calls to minErr instances. minErr will be our new error API going forward. Take a look at minErr in `src/minErr.js`.

title: fix($location): default to / for the url base if no base[href]
body:
With the recent refactoring of $location service we changed this behavior
resulting in a regression.

Previously we thought that html5 mode always required base[href]
to be set in order for urls to resolve properly. It turns out that
base[href] is problematic because it makes anchor urls (#foo) to
always resolve to the base url, which is almost always incorrect
and results in all anchors links and other anchor urls (e.g. svg
references) to be broken.

For this reason, we should now start recommending that people just
deploy to root context (/) and not set the base[href] when using
the html5 mode (push/pop history state).

If it's impossible to deploy to the root context then either all
urls in the app must be absolute or base[href] must be set with the
caveat that anchor urls in such app won't work.

Closes #2762

title: NgAnimate: parallel animations, add/remove classes and callbacks
chore(ngdocs): provide test code for lunr search in docs
Fixes to docs + jqLite
body:
- Lunr 0.4.0 is much faster than what we had before.
- jqLite trigger handler does not support event object override.
- Allow user to press escape key to close the docs search.

title: emit a <className>-done event when an animation is finished
body: It would be nice to be able to know when animations are done. This change emits a '<className>-done' event which could be used to coordinate actions to take place after an animation has finished.
